column3: Saints Mary and Gabriel visit an Ethiopian named Gabra Maryam and heal him.
The Egyptian woman who lost a silver plate while bathing in a miraculous spring.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በብሔረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ እምበዐላተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ሖረት፡ ኀበ፡ ነቅዐ፡ ማይ፡ ዘይሰቅዩ፡ እምኔሁ፡ በለሳነ፡ ወተጠምቀት፡ ወተሐጽበት፡ ምስለ፡ ደቂቃ
column15: Folio start 146r accorfing to catalog https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog04/page/n333/mode/2up

column3: The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Paraleya from Iyyoram, who was beaten by her husband because she was childless.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በሀገረ፡ ኢዮራም፡ ዘስማ፡ ጰራልያ፡ ብእሲተ፡ ዓሣ፡ መርዐተ፡ ኢዩ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ወነበረት፡ በትካዝ፡ እንዘ፡ የሐምም፡ ልባ፡ በእንተ፡ ዘአልባ፡ ውሉደ

column3: The dogs of the hunter praise Saint Mary.
Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob is given a sign of Badlay's fall.
Saint Mary appears to the gabaz of her church in Waybela and tells him about the fall of Badlay.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
column12: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ኮነ፡ በውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ይጸንሕ፡ ፍኖተ፡ ወያፈርህ፡ ለኵሉ፡ ለእለ፡ የሐውሩ፡ በፍኖት

column3: The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ወክቡር፡ ፈድፋደ፡ ወኀያል፡ በግርማሁ፡ ወነግሠ፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵሉ፡ ምድር፡ ወተቀንዩ፡ ሎቱ፡ ኵሉ፡ ሰብእ

column3: Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መስተጽዕነ፡ ፈረስ፡ ኃጥእ፡ በኵሉ፡ ፍናዊሁ፡ ዓለማዊት፡ ወባሕቱ፡ በጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወበስእለታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. መርሐቶ፡ ኀበ፡ መድኀኒተ፡ ነፍሱ

column3: The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ውኁደ፡ ሠናያት፡ ዘኢየአምሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወኢያስተሰሪ፡ በእንተ፡ ኀጢአቱ

column3: The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ኄር፡ በኵሉ፡ ግብሩ፡ ወኢያደሉ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ሢመቱ

column3: The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ግብር፡ ሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወመሥመሬ፡ አኃው፡ ውእቱ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ረከቦ፡ ድቀተ፡ ሥጋ፡ ዘአምጽአ፡ ሎቱ፡ ጸላኢ፡ ርእዮ፡ ትግሀታቲሁ

column3: The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The knight who wanted to seduce the daughter of the cobbler.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
column12: ይቤ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ብሎስ፡ ሕፃን፡ እምውስተ፡ አይሁድ፡ እንዘ፡ ይትናገር፡ ምስለ፡ ውሉደ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወኀበ፡ አሐዱ፡ መምህር

column3: The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
column12: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ባሕር፡ ዘታዐዱ፡ ኵሎ፡ ዓለመ፡ ወበውስተ፡ ጽንፈ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ባሕር፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ሕንጽት፡ በስመ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ሊቀ፡ መላእክት

column3: The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
column12: ወኮነት፡ እንከ፡ ብእሲት፡ ነዳይት፡ ወባቲ፡ አሐደ፡ ወልደ፡ ወኮነት፡ ይእቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ትበውእ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወትበውእ፡ ኀበ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

column3: The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ ዘመነኮሳት፡ ኀበ፡ ጽንፈ፡ ባሕር፡ ወሀሎ፡ ውስቴቱ፡ አሐዱ፡ እኅው፡ ዘመንኰሰ፡ እምንእሱ፡ ወውእቱሰ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሠናይ፡ ውእቱ

column3: The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
column12: ተብህለ፡ በእንተ፡ አኃው፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንዘ፡ የሐውሩ፡ ኀበ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ወረከቡ፡ በህየ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ በስሙ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ጳውሎስ፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስመ፡ ዚአሁ

column3: The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
column12: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ እምሰብአ፡ አፍራስ፡ እስመ፡ ውእቱ፡ ኮነ፡ ፈረሳዊ፡ ጽኑዕ፡ በውርዙቱ፡ ወይዜሀር፡ በብዝኀ፡ ጥሪቱ። ወኮነ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለአሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ላሕይት፡ ዘትነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወወሀባ፡ ንዋየ፡ ብዙኀ፡ ወኢተክህሎ፡ ከመ፡ ይትራከብ፡ ምስሌሃ

column3: The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
The robber whom a bishop was commanded to bury after he was executed.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ግብር፡ ሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወመሥመሬ፡ አኃው፡ ውእቱ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ረከቦ፡ ድቀተ፡ ሥጋ፡ ዘአምጽአ፡ ሎቱ፡ ጸላኢ፡ ርእዮ፡ ትግሀታቲሁ
column15: According to Macomber handlist, this mss has two stories with ID 144, on ff. 19v and 66r. Macomber gave incipits of one of the two stories, but he didn't specify a folio number. So currently both instances have identical incipits in the spreadsheet and the ITool. Catalog doesn't contain miracle records, the mss is online.

column3: The priest from Nārdin who was accused because he kept a nun in his house.
The wife of a pagan official who wished to pray at the Holy Sepulcher is prevented until she is baptized.
The abbot who did not allow the Miracles of Mary to be read in his monastery.
Emperor Honorius, who lived like a monk.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ንጉሥ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮም፡ ዘስሙ፡ አኖሬዎስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ፈድፋደ። ወነበረ፡ አኖሬዎስ፡ በመንግሥቱ፡ እንዘ፡ ይኰንን፡ በጽድቅ፡ ሠራዊቱ

column3: Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: When she is three years old, Saint Mary is taken to the Temple.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
Oz, the Byzantine monk, is shown a vision of Hell by Saint Urael.
Mary, Engagement of cycle: Saint Mary is espoused to Saint Joseph.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
Mary, Pregnancy of: Salome's hands are burned when she tries to verify Saint Mary's virginity, but they are healed when she takes the Christ Child into her arms.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
The Jews plot to burn the body of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: When Tafoneya lays hands on the bier of Saint Mary, an angel cuts his arms off.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays to be taken from this life.
Mary, Assumption of Cycle: The Apostles gather for the funeral of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees Christ kissing Saint Mary's burial cloth.
Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
A monk, Abraham, drinks poisonous water while on a journey to visit the patriarch and dies, but is then raised from the dead.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: The annual apparition of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq (continued)
King Bartaqu of Greece, who became a monk.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ንጉሥ፡ በደወለ፡ ፅርዕ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በርጠቁ፡ ወልደ፡ ኤጴሜን፡ ኃያል፡ በመንግሥቱ፡ ወጽኑዕ፡ ከመ፡ ዓምደ፡ ሐፂን

column3: Abba Mardari, who overheard twelve angels talking about going to Constantinople to hear Saint John Chrysostom praise Saint Mary.
A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ በደብረ፡ ጢሞና፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኤፍሬም፡ ዐሥጋሬ፡ ዓሣ፡ ለመነኮሳተ፡ ደብር፡ ወይገብር፡ በዓለ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ዘነሥአት፡ ኪዳነ፡ ምሕረት፡ እምኀበ፡ ወልዳ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወለለ፡ ዓመት፡ በዕለተ፡ በዓላ፡ ያጸግቦሙ፡ ለኵሎሙ፡ ሰብአ፡ ደብር

column3: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ, together with Saint Mary and the angels, appears to the Apostles and asks them to build churches in his name and hers throughout the world.
Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon instructs his disciples on his deathbed.
Homily of Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob on Saint Mary as the hope of salvation.
column12: ድርሳን፡ ዘደረሰ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይምሐሮ፡ በጸሎታ፡…. ይቤ፡ ከመዝ፡ ስምዑኬ፡ ኦምእምናን፡ ኦክርስቶሳውያን፡ ደቂቀ፡ ወንጌል፡ አልብነ፡ ተስፋ፡ ወኢድሂን፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ማርያም፡ እግዝእትነ

column3: The story of Saint Alexius [Abdo l a-Masih], son of Emperor Theodosius.
The healing of the Egyptian King Soforon (or Safron).
Saint Mary turns water over which her anaphora was recited by Abba Samuˀel of Wali into miraculous bread.
The story of Dilasor, brother of Emperor Theodosius, who was Abba Kiros.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ እኅወ፡ ቴዎዶስዮስ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዲላሶር፡ ወአስተርአዮ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘለዘክሮቱ፡ ይደሉ፡ ስግደት፡ ወለጣዕመ፡ ስሙ፡ አኰቴት፡ ሌሊተ፡ በሕልም፡ ወይቤሎ፡ ሑር፡ ውስተ፡ ደብረ፡ ባሳን

column3: Samuˀel of Wali miracles: Christ orders Abba Samu'el of Wali to celebrate Mass for the feast of Saint Mary.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘገዳመ፡ ዋሊ፡ ወመጽአ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ በዐቢይ፡ ስብሐት፡ ወይቤሎ፡ ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ ኦኅሩይየ፡ ሳሙኤል

column3: Samuˀel of Wali miracles: Abba Samuˀel of Wali is lifted up while reciting the Wəddase Maryam.
column12: ወእንዘ፡ ይጼሊ፡ ካዕበ፡ ዝንቱ፡ አቡነ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ወወጠነ፡ አንብቦ፡ ውዳሴሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወአንቀልቀለ፡ ምድር፡ እምመሰረቱ፡ ወይነብር፡ ውስቴቱ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ወተለዓለ፡ እምምድር፡ መጠነ፡ እመት

column3: The king who invited Abba Abreham to come and discuss spiritual matters.
A bishop asks a man for the prayer that saved him from Satan.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq (continued)
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan appears to King Herod and advises him to kill the Innocents.
column12: ወበይእቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ሞተ፡ ስምዖን፡ ካህን፡ አረጋዊ። ወነበረ፡ ሄሮድስ፡ ፪፡ ዓመተ፡ እንዘ፡ ይጸንሖሙ፡ ለሰብአ፡ ሰገል

column3: Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The arrival of the Holy Family in Sāmǝnon.
column12: ወእምዝ፡ በጽሐ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሳምኖን፡ ውስተ፡ ቀዳሚ፡ አንቀጽ፡ ማኅፈድ፡ በ፬፡ መዓዝኒሁ፡ ወይትሌዓል፡ እምኵሉ፡ ሀገር

column3: Christ, Nativity of cycle: The shepherds and the magi come to worship Christ.
Holy Family journey cycle: The king of Egypt asks Saint Mary to bless his land.
When Pariqos of Fesa confesses his sins to the bishop, the latter, refusing him absolution, tells him to go to Abba Yaceqob (Santiago).
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles:  Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and the invasion of Badlay.
Saint Mary heals in Bethlehem a large multitude of sick people who had sought her in the Temple.
column12: ወእምዝ፡ ተጋብኡ፡ ብዙኃን፡ ሕዝብ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ወብዙኃን፡ ድውያን፡ መጽኡ፡ ወይቤሉ፡ አይቴ፡ ሀለወት፡ ቡርክት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወአውሥኡ፡ ወይቤልዎሙ፡ ኢሀለወት፡ ዝየ፡ ይእቲሰ፡ ቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ትነብር

column3: The Stephanites in Egypt and Palestine.
Saint Mary heals a servant girl from a magic spell.
A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
Saint Mary asks Christ to bless those who honor her and pray for her help.
Saint Mary receives the Pact of Mercy (kidan mehret) (Synaxary entry for the 16th of Yakkatit)
The three monks who attempted to say Mass in a mosque.
A Christian from Bethlehem is restored to his community after being sold into slavery by the Turks and beaten and slain by his master.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እንዘ፡ የሐውር፡ በሐመር፡ ምስለ፡ ንዋዩ፡ ወመጽኡ፡ ትርኵ፡ ወአኃዝዎ፡ ወወሰድዎ፡ ወሤጥዎ፡ ውስተ፡ ካልእ፡ ሀገር

column3: Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
A Muslim herder starts to build a shrine to Saint Mary on good land; when he dies, she saves his soul from the angels of darkness.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ አረማዊ፡ ኖላዌ፡ አልሕምት፡ ወሶበ፡ ወፈረ፡ ወሖረ፡ ውስተ፡ ገዳም፡ ምስለ፡ አልሕምት፡ ወረከበ፡ ምድረ፡ ሠናየ፡ ዘያስተፌሥሕ፡ ልበ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወይቤ፡ ምስጋዶሙ፡ ለክርስቲያን፡ በውእቱ፡ መካን፡ ይሤኒ

column3: Samuˀel of Wali miracles: Saint Mary brings gifts to Abba Samuˀel of Wali.
A Christian retainer escapes unharmed when his king is defeated by the Muslims.
column12: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘእምወዓልያኒሁ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወያነብብ፡ ውዳሴያቲሃ፡ ወዕበያቲሃ፡ ኵሎ፡ አሚረ፡ ወይትመሐፀን፡ ባቲ። ወበአሐዱ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ሖረ፡ ምስለ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ውስተ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወውስተ፡ ብሔረ፡ አረሚ

column3: The woman who was crossing a river on a raft [mezlal].
column12: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ዘታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወትትመሐፀን፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ወታነብብ፡ ሰላመ፡ መልአክ፡ ረሰያ፡ ልማዳ፡ ከመ፡ ትትባላሕ፡ እምመናግንተ፡ ሰይጣን፡ በኅቡዕ፡ ወበገሃድ

column3: The dogs of the hunter praise Saint Mary.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
The man who was possessed by a spirit of epilepsy [nagargar] for 47 years.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
The pious abbot who was falsely accused by his monks of sinning with a woman.
The fisherman who was eaten up by a dragon but was found alive when the dragon's belly was cut open.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
Saint Mary gives a thirsty dog water to drink from her shoe.
The poor man from Aragon [Spain] who was buried alive in a gold mine.
The husband who denied Christ when he became poor.
A sinner is saved from damnation because he had built a shrine in the name of Saint Mary.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: A soldier redeems the Child Jesus from another soldier who was thinking of handing him over to King Herod.
Saint Mary appears to a monk and saves him from being deceived by Satan.
A child and his mother see the icon of Saint Mary weeping for the sins of the world.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: The birth of Saint Mary on the first of Genbot.
column12: ንግባእኬ፡ ሀበ፡ ጥንተ፡ ነገር። ወሶበ፡ ተፈጸመ፡ መዋዕለ፡ ፅንሳ፡ ወለደት፡ ወለተ፡ አመ፡ ፩፡ ለግንቦት፡ እንዘ፡ ትበርህ፡ እምነ፡ ፀሐይ

column3: Mary, Childhood of cycle: Saint Mary stays in the Temple.
Saint Mary stops a pestilence.
An unbaptized Jewess attempts to enter the house of Saint Mary, who prevents her and tells her to seek baptism.
Saint Mary helps a poor man become wealthy.
The temptations that Akroseya, the wife of Qawestos, overcame.
Saint Mary heals the wounds of Ermeyis of Sidon with a drop of her milk.
Saint Mary prays to Christ on the 16th of Yakkatit.
column12: አመ፡ ፲ወ፮፡ ለወርኃ፡ የካቲት፡ እንዘ፡ ትጼሊ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውስተ፡ መቃብረ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ መጽአ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ወይቤለ፡ ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ ኦእምየ፡ ምንተ፡ ተኃሥሢ

column3: The people of Febor sacrifice pigs at the gate of their city so as to prevent the Holy Family from entering; they themselves are changed into pigs.
column12: ስምዑ፡ ኵልክሙ፡ ፍቁራኒሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ በጊዜ፡ ልደታ። ሶበ፡ በጽሐት፡ ሀገረ፡ ፌቦር፡ ርእይዋ፡ እምርኁቅ፡ እነ፡ ትመጽእ፡ ኀቤሆሙ፡ ተባሀሉ፡ በበይናቲሆሙ፡ ዛቲኬ፡ ብእሲት፡ እንተ፡ ሰማዕነ፡ በእንቲአሃ፡ ትሤርያ፡ ለኵላ፡ ሀገር

column3: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob kills Badlay and dimembers his body.
column12: ስምዑ፡ ዘገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ ኃይለ፡ ወተአምረ፡ ለንጉሥነ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ወበጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘተሰምየ፡ ቍስጠንጢኖስ፡ ወለኵሉ፡ አበዊሁ፡ ወአኃዊሁ፡ እለ፡ ነግሡ፡ እምቅድሜሁ፡ ገብረት፡ ኃይለ፡ ተአምር፡ በእንተ፡ ኪዳና፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ኍልቍ፡ ቀተሎ፡ ለንጉሠ፡ ሰብአ፡ አደል፡ ዘስሙ፡ በድላይ

column3: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob writes the Book of the Miracles of Mary.
column12: ወእምቅድመ፡ ይሑር፡ ውስተ፡ ፀብዕ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ቅቡዕ፡ ጸሐፈ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወአዘዘ፡ ለኵሎሙ፡ ሰብአ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ያክብርዋ፡ በበዓለ፡ ኪዳና

column3: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles:  Zärˀa Yaˁəqob, returning victorious, builds a church in the name of Saint Mary and commands the observance of her feast.
column12: ወእምዝ፡ አቲዎ፡ እምፀብዕ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ በፍሥሐ፡ ወበሐሤት፡ ምስለ፡ ብዙኅ፡ ዕልገቱ፡ ወሰከ፡ አክብሮታ፡ ወአፍቅሮታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

column3: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob composes chants in honor of Saint Mary.
column12: ወበእንተዝ፡ ሰብሓ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ወአልዓላ፡ አድመፀ፡ ማኅሌተ፡ ቅኔ፡ በበዓላ

column3: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles:  Zärˀa Yaˁəqob establishes the cult of the Trinity throughout his empire.
column12: ወካዕበ፡ ገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ ለዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመድምመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በእንተ፡ ኪዳና፡ ዳግመ፡ በፍቅረ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ወቆመ፡ ወአቅነተቶ፡ ኃይለ፡ ከመ፡ ኢይኩን፡ ድኩመ

column3: Saint Mary helps Emperor Na'od humble the Jews.
column12: ወካዕበ፡ ስምዑ፡ አኃዊነ፡ ዘኮነ፡ በመዋዕሊነ፡ ሶበ፡ አንሥኦ፡ ፀረ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ከመ፡ ይፅባዕ፡ ቅዱሳነ

column3: Saint Mary assists the emperors of Ethiopia.
column12: ለነገሥትኒ፡ እለ፡ ነግሡ፡ በአፍቅሮታ፡ ወጳጳሳትኒ፡ እለ፡ ሰበኩ፡ ነገረ፡ ኪዳና

column3: Thecla cycle: Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
The man who accepted fine clothes as a bribe for future favors.
A plague in a monastery is halted at the prayer of a monk.
The priest from Cyprus who brought a particle of the Eucharist to a Jew.
A child whom his mother had vowed to Saint Mary is rescued from drowning.
The monk who saved the church of Saint Mary in Atrib by his prayers when its destruction had been ordered by the Caliph.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
Saint Mary comes to a church in the form of a white dove to heal from smallpox a man whose only good work was celebrating her commemoration.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይገብር፡ ተዝካራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ወካልዕሰ፡ አልቦቱ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ አሚነ፡ ወልዳ። ወአሐዞ፡ ሕማመ፡ ፈጸንት፡ ለውእቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአጽዓቆ፡ ወቀርበ፡ ለመዊት

column3: Sara from Mesot, who became insane and went about naked.
The three monks who attempted to say Mass in a mosque.
The woman whose baby daughter was carried off by a hyena.
A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
An official who used to rob the poor is converted when a monk reveals that Satan was acting as his counsellor.
Saint Mary stops a pestilence.
An unbaptized Jewess attempts to enter the house of Saint Mary, who prevents her and tells her to seek baptism.
Saint Mary helps a poor man become wealthy.
A thief is hanged upside down with the objects he stole from the church of Saint Mary in Sebkahad.
Tekta, who is childless, has a dream about ten generations ending with the moon and the sun.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: The Jews plot to kill Saint Mary because of the miracles she was working while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Saint Mary leaves the Temple and enters the home of Saint Joseph.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The adoration of the shepherds and the Magi.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The Circumcision.
Holy Family journey cycle: Herod orders the slaughter of the Innocents; a hunter with his dogs finds the Holy Family in flight from the king.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to return from the mountains of Lebanon to Bethlehem.
Holy Family journey cycle: An angel tells Saint Joseph to take Saint Mary and her child to Egypt.
Däbrä Sedeneya miracles: Some officials visit the icon of Saint Mary at Däbrä Sedeneya.
column12: ይቤ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ተስእልክዎ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ግብጻዊ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ፈራሃ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዜናሃ፡ ለሥዕል፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ፄዴንያ፡ ወዘከመ፡ ያስተርኢ፡ ተአምራት፡ ወመንክራት፡ እምኔሃ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይጸግወነ፡ በረካታ፡ አሜን። ወአውሥአኒ፡ ወይቤለኒ፡ ስማዕ፡ እንግርከ፡ ኦወልድየ

column3: The European who tried to steal the icon of Saint Mary from Däbrä Sedeneya.
Christ gives Ethiopia as tithes to Saint Mary.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: The Muslims who spent the night at the ruins of Däbrä Metmaq.
column12: ነገር፡ ዘከመ፡ ዜነወ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘተብህለት፡ ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ በደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ድኅረ፡ አንሐልዋ፡ ተንበላት፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን። ወእንዘ፡ የሐውሩ፡ ተንበላት፡ ፱፡ ወ፪፡ ደቂቆሙ፡ ንዑሳን፡ ኀበ፡ ነጊድ፡ ወአግማለ፡ ወአዕዱገ፡ ፅዒኖሙ፡ ወበጽሑ፡ ኀበ፡ ደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ወይእቲ፡ ዕለት፡ በዓላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

column3: Dabra  Qaləmon miracles: An Arab steals the scissors of the tailor of Dabra Qaləmon.
The European who wanted to steal the bars of the door to the Manger at Bethlehem.
Nəkʷal, the deacon from Margawkim, who spent his master’s money on the poor.
The Frenchman whose wife was unable to have children.
The woman from Cairo who lived by the river and whose daughter became blind.
The son of a rich official of Cappadocia is raised from the dead.
When Pariqos of Fesa confesses his sins to the bishop, the latter, refusing him absolution, tells him to go to Abba Yaceqob (Santiago).
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family hides from thieves in a sycamore tree at Däbrä Metmaq.
Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: The people of an Egyptian town set fierce dogs on the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: The inhabitants of an Egyptian town who plot to hand Jesus over to King Herod are turned into animals.
Holy Family journey cycle: The king of Egypt asks Saint Mary to bless his land.
column12: ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውስተ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወሰሚዖ፡ ንጉሥ፡ እምርኁቅ፡ ዜናሃ፡ ለአከ፡ ኀቤሃ

column3: The wrath of Saint Mary against the prefect of a church who tried to stop the priests from making a procession while singing hymns to her.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles:  Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and the invasion of Badlay.
Abba Mardari, who overheard twelve angels talking about going to Constantinople to hear Saint John Chrysostom praise Saint Mary.
The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Saint Mary cures the son of a Roman official in Bethlehem.
Saint Mary heals a woman possessed by evil spirits.
A woman whose right eye had been blinded by a demon is healed by Saint Mary.
An Egyptian woman comes to Saint Mary in Bethlehem and is healed of her fever.
Saint Mary appears to Timothy, Patriarch of Alexandria, in the church of Saint Pachomius in Alexandria.
Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: Saint Mary appears to Anthony of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam (continued).
Vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The life of Saint Mary to the birth of Christ.
Abba Behor has a vision of Saint Mary.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
Dabra Qaləmon miracles: The monk of Dabra Qaləmon who did not fast.
ʾƎmma Yoḥannǝs and the Ethiopian monk who was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
The conversion of the Muslim, Rewh, who is renamed Entons Haddis.
Scete miracles: Saint Mary blesses Scete, which Saint Macarius chooses for his monastery.
Saint Mary appears to Yohannes Kama.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: God sends Saint Gabriel to Saint Mary for the Annunciation.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The descent of the holy seed from Adam to Saint Mary.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: Saint Mary heals the daughter of Arsaban while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: The Jews plot to kill Saint Mary because of the miracles she was working while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Saint Mary leaves the Temple and enters the home of Saint Joseph.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The adoration of the shepherds and the Magi.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The Circumcision.
Holy Family journey cycle: Herod orders the slaughter of the Innocents; a hunter with his dogs finds the Holy Family in flight from the king.
Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter reports to King Demateyanos, who comes to visit the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: An angel tells Saint Joseph to take Saint Mary and her child to Egypt.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to return from the mountains of Lebanon to Bethlehem.
Holy Family journey cycle: All Israel is upset by the coming of the Magi; Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to flee to the mountains of Lebanon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Magi find the Holy Family and depart; Saint Mary flees to Tiberias and from there to the mountains of Lebanon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family stays in Dirde.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary's prayer while in the wilderness of Edomeyas.
Oz, the Byzantine monk, is shown a vision of Hell by Saint Urael.
A child and his mother see the icon of Saint Mary weeping for the sins of the world.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (opening)
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan urges Herod to pursue the Holy Family.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
The Frenchman whose wife was unable to have children.
Dabra Qaləmon miracles: The monk of Dabra Qaləmon who did not fast.
Dabra  Qaləmon miracles: An Arab steals the scissors of the tailor of Dabra Qaləmon.
Qommos Raphael from Däbrä ʾƎnṣǝnā and the sacrament of confession.
Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: An Arab who has contempt for Saint Mary’s icon at Däbrä Qaləmon is punished.
The composition of the Maṣḥafa ḥawi by Patriarch Gabriel Ibn Tarīk.
Amnut, the custodian of a church in Egypt, quarrels with his bishop.
Nəkʷal, the deacon from Margawkim, who spent his master’s money on the poor.
The priest from Nārdin who was accused because he kept a nun in his house.
The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.
Yoḥannǝs finds a copy of the acts of Saints Juliana and Barbara that he had lost.
ʾƎmma Yoḥannǝs and the Ethiopian monk who was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
The European who wanted to steal the bars of the door to the Manger at Bethlehem.
The lamp of the Christian from Mǝneta Diyāqon that was blown out by the wind.
The wife of Joseph from Mǝneta Diyāqon, who had no male children.
The poor man from Aragon [Spain] who was buried alive in a gold mine.
The husband who denied Christ when he became poor.
The devout Muslim who became a Christian when Saint Mary appeared to him.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: The annual apparition of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq (continued)
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: The untrustworthy camel driver of Däbrä Metmaq.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: Yeshaq, prior of Däbrä Metmaq, who fled to Scete, Egypt, to escape the burden of his office.
Scete miracles: Eulogius, the stonemason of Scete, Egypt, who used to give hospitality to strangers.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.

column15: ID 40 on f. 99v is a recopying.

column3: The old woman from Sembat who gave the offering for Saint Mary to Saint George.
The conversion of a Muslim merchant who had been imprisoned in Naples.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.
column12: ዘከመ፡ ተስእላ፡ ሠለስቱ፡ ደናግል፡ ዘከመ፡ ወለደት፡ አምላከ። ወእምዝ፡ መጽኣ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ፫፡ ደናግል፡ እለ፡ ይትቀነያ፡ ላቲ፡ ወይቤላሃ፡ ኢትኅዝኒ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ነሕነሰ፡ ንመጽእ፡ ምስሌኪ
column15: ID 51 on f. 162r is a recopying.

column3: Däbrä Metmaq miracles: Bishop Michael sends Deacon John to help the monks of Däbrä Metmaq celebrate Passion Week.
The story of the martyr, Saint Victor, and his mother, Martha.
The abbot who did not allow the Miracles of Mary to be read in his monastery.
Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: A man killed during the construction of the church of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam is raised from the dead.
The story of the sorcerers Taludar, who was possessed by a demon.
Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: The vinedresser of Manfalut who gave his earnings to the builders of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: The infidel who stole the lumber from the church at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
A man who speaks blasphemously of Saint Mary has his arms and legs cut off.
Entawos, a pagan from Qarays, becomes a Christian after being struck by miraculous arrows.
The wife of a pagan official who wished to pray at the Holy Sepulcher is prevented until she is baptized.
The son of Emperor Tiberius is raised from the dead.
John the Evangelist paints an icon of the Crucifixion for Emperor Tiberius.
Petros Bawares has a vision of the Trinity.
The conversion of the Muslim, Rewh, who is renamed Entons Haddis.
column15: F. 73v is a copy of f. 72v (ID 77) (catalog)

column3: Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: The monks of Saint Anthony celebrate Holy Week at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
The wife of Mark, a priest from Mallawi, is cured of her leprosy.
A Muslim, Katib, tries to extort money from the monks of Saint Anthony.
Homily of John Chrysostom on the visit of Saint Mary and her Son to John the Baptist.
The story of John, the martyr from Senhut.
The Jews plot to burn the body of Saint Mary.
A Roman official is prevented from approaching the Holy Sepulcher.
Scete miracles: Emperor Zeno builds churches in Scete.
Scete miracles: Saint Mary blesses Scete, which Saint Macarius chooses for his monastery.
The story of Michael, the scribe who converted to Islam when he was beaten.
The story of the Muslim who lived near the churches of Saints Mark and Shenute.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
A monk, Abraham, drinks poisonous water while on a journey to visit the patriarch and dies, but is then raised from the dead.
The story of Absadi, gardener of the monastery of St. Shenute, who used to give away vegetables from the garden.
The wrath of Saint Mary against the prefect of a church who tried to stop the priests from making a procession while singing hymns to her.
Homily on the miracles of Saint Mary.
The persecution of the Christians during the patriarchate of Cosmas II.
The withered olive tree at the gate of the church in Endules.
The story of the penitent harlot, Mary of Egypt.
Patriarch Abraham and the interpretation of the parable of the mustard seed.
Emperor Arcadius and the golden statue of Saint Mary; he asks Saint John Chrysostom to expound on Matthew 1: 25.
The woman from Cairo who lived by the river and whose daughter became blind.
The beggar at the church of Qirqos in Amhara from whose head a horn grew.
Mary, Assumption of Cycle: The Apostles gather for the funeral of Saint Mary.
The merchant from Senfewat who struck the icon of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: When Tafoneya lays hands on the bier of Saint Mary, an angel cuts his arms off.
The healing of the Egyptian King Soforon (or Safron).
King Dawit miracles: The miracle concerning the golden ink during the reign of King Dawit.
The chastisement of the heretic, Nestorius.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the rich man who refused to give him a tablet [saleda] for an icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the Jewish merchant of Caesarea who stole a golden plate from the church, but later became a Christian.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
column12: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘገብረቶ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ አመ፡ ፰፡ ለወርኀ፡ ሰኔ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ምሕፃብ፡ ዘዕውቅት፡ ኀበ፡ መቅዐ፡ ማይ፡ ቡሩክ፡ ዘነቅዓ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ

column3: The story of Saint Menas and his brother.
The election of Patriarch Matthew I.
The story of Saint Alexius [Abdo l a-Masih], son of Emperor Theodosius.
Holy Family journey cycle: The places in Egypt visited by the Holy Family.
Abba Mardari, who overheard twelve angels talking about going to Constantinople to hear Saint John Chrysostom praise Saint Mary.
Thecla cycle: Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
Abba Behor has a vision of Saint Mary.
Saint Paul is taken to the third heaven and there sees Saint Mary.
Vision of Gregory the Seer [ra'eya hebu'at].
Saint Mary appears to Sawla, the wife of the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis.
The history ot Däbrä Mahew near Jerusalem and its miraculous spring.
The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Saint Mary cures the son of a Roman official in Bethlehem.
Saint Mary heals a woman possessed by evil spirits.
Saint Mary appears to Timothy, Patriarch of Alexandria, in the church of Saint Pachomius in Alexandria.

Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: Saint Mary appears to Anthony of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam (continued).
Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: An Arab steals the scissors of the tailor of Däbrä Qaləmon.

The priest who left the keys of the church locked up inside.
Vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The life of Saint Mary to the birth of Christ.
Vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The flight into Egypt.
Vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family receives hospitality from a shepherd.
Vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Christ Child grants Saint Mary a vision of his future glory.

column12: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወተናገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወእምድኅረ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ኃለፍነ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ካልእት፡ ወኢኃደገነ፡ ፍርሃት

Vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family encounters thieves.
Vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family arrives at Däbrä QWesqWam.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews try to burn down the house where Saint Mary is staying but are burned up instead.
Saint Peter gives Saint John Chrysostom the keys of the kingdom and Saint John the Evangelist gives him the Gospels; then Saint Mary appears to him.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples.
The Holy Spirit recounts the salvific events that have occurred on Sunday.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays for the release of the souls in judgment.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples (continuation).
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees a vision of Saint Mary in glory.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks Christ that the disciples preach her Transitus and Assumption.

column3: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ, together with Saint Mary and the angels, appears to the Apostles and asks them to build churches in his name and hers throughout the world.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews go to Bethlehem to seize Saint Mary but are blinded.
Christ makes Saint Peter head of the Church.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary, together with Saints Irene and Sophia, appears to Saint Basil and tells him where her icon is buried.
column15: The miracle continues on f. 160r (according to catalog and Macomber handlist)

column3: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Prochorus reports Saint John's visit to Saint Mary's dwelling place.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks that Saint John be allowed to visit her dwelling place.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays to be taken from this life.
column15: The miracle continues on f. 158r (according to catalog and Macomber handlist)

column3: Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil finds the buried icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary tells Saint Basil to take two pillars from a pagan temple.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary sets up the pillars in the church and makes a miraculous spring flow out at their base.
Mary, Pregnancy of: Salome's hands are burned when she tries to verify Saint Mary's virginity, but they are healed when she takes the Christ Child into her arms.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees Christ kissing Saint Mary's burial cloth.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary's soul descends from heaven in a tent of light.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.

column3: Saint John Chrysostom defends a woman whom Nestorius had told the people to spit upon.
A woman who had poisoned her sister and married her husband is swallowed up by the earth when she anoints herself with the oil that flowed from Saint Mary's icon.
Saint Mary rescues the ship in which Mar Barsuma is travelling.
Saint Mary appears to Saints Atrasis and Yona, virgins and martyrs.
Saint Mary appears to the disciples of Mar Barsuma in the form of a dove.
Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: The events that occurred during the captivity of Abbots Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon and John of Scete.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Sarabamon, the future bishop of Nikiou and martyr.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Nicholas and gives him priestly vestments.
Saint Mary appears to the brother of Saint Basil, Saint Gregory, bishop of "the Islands" (i.e. of Nyassa).
Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: Saint Mary raises Andrew, a disciple of Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon, from the dead.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Paphnutius.
Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon instructs his disciples on his deathbed.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Theodore the Anatolian.
The fate of the monk, Giyorgis, who followed the teachings of Za-Mika'el.
Abbas sees a vision of Saint Mary blessing the monks who were chanting the Psalms.
Vision of a certain saint about the fate of a priest who swore falsely.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: The judgment of the court of Zärˀa Yaˁəqob against the Stephanites.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Anonymous homily against the report that the Apostles abandoned the body of Saint Mary when they were attacked by the Jews during her funeral procession.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Synaxary entry for 16 Nahase: The Apostles visit Saint Mary in heaven.
A Christian community is attacked by a neighboring Muslim community.
A renegade monk who had become a Jew is hunted down by the troops of the king.
A Jew is led to baptism by a dream about a lion and a monk; afterwards he curses a Jew at the latter's request.
The Magicians who tried to cast a spell on the Epiphany water.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: The birth of the prince, Batergela Maryam.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and Batergela Maryam, who is accused of treason and is imprisoned but delivered from the plague.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and Batergela Maryam, who is protected from the plague; his calumniator is punished by the king.
Vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family arrives at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
When Satan destroys the oven of a monastery, he is compelled to serve the monks for twelve years in punishment.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: Saint Mary shows those assembled at Däbrä Metmaq a vision of Mohammad in Hell.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The brigands who killed each other at the miraculous spring.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
Scete miracles: Some of the deceased great Fathers of the Desert appear to the monks of Scete.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: Bishop Michael sends Deacon John to help the monks of Däbrä Metmaq celebrate Passion Week.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: Yeshaq, prior of Däbrä Metmaq, who fled to Scete, Egypt, to escape the burden of his office.
Saint Mary appears as a winged maiden to John, a monk of Saint Macarius.
Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
Saint Mary appears to Yohannes Kama.
During the famine of 1120 MM [likely 1404 CE], the Arabs try to plunder the monasteries of Egypt.
The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary and fell into the doing of a sin.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The church built on the tomb of Saint Mary that will turn into a ship.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.
A priest is warned by an angel not to rush when incensing the icon of Saint Mary.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: An Arab who has contempt for Saint Mary’s icon at Däbrä Qaləmon is punished.
The devout Muslim who became a Christian when Saint Mary appeared to him.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.
The lamp before the icon of Saint Mary that the priest tipped over.
The two blessed monks, Sadaqā and ʾƎstifānos, from the monastery of Saint Victor.
The story of Pifamon, the martyr from Awsim.
Thecla cycle: Thecla is taken to Alexandria to see her brother, Abba Esi, in a boat guided by the Archangels Gabriel and Sureyal.
Thecla cycle: Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
Thecla cycle: Abba Esi and Thecla are saved from the torture ordered by the judge (continuation of the preceding).
The wealthy man to whom Saint Mary appeared in the form of a bird to save the countryside from pestilence.
The man who accepted fine clothes as a bribe for future favors.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወይነብሩ፡ ውስቴታ፡ ሰብእ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዐቢያን፡ በብዙኅ፡ ዕቅበት

column3: Saint Mary stops a pestilence.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ዐባይ፡ ወብዙኃን፡ ሰብእ፡ ይነብሩ፡ ውስቴታ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ወኤጲስ፡ ቆጶሳት፡ ቀሳውስት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ወመነኮሳት፡ ወሕዝብ፡ ዘኢይትኈለቍ። ወቦአ፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ሞተ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወቀተለ፡ ብዙኃነ፡ ሰብአ፡ እደ፡ ወአንስተ

column3: A plague in a monastery is halted at the prayer of a monk.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወቦአ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤቱ፡ ብድብድ፡ ወአኀዘ፡ ይቅትሎሙ፡ ለደቂቁ

column3: A priest becomes insane after his entire family dies of the plague.
A stream runs uphill after his neighbor had diverted it.
column12: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሐፃቤ፡ አልባስ፡ ወእንዘ፡ የሐፅብ፡ ልብሰ፡ መጽአ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወሜጠ፡ ማየ፡ እንተ፡ ካልእ፡ ፍኖት

column3: The cupbearer of the king of France.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
column12: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ዲያቆን፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ዘኢይክሉ፡ ነጊረ፡ እከዮ፡ ወኀጣውኢሁ

column3: The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
The monk who saved the church of Saint Mary in Atrib by his prayers when its destruction had been ordered by the Caliph.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
When Pariqos of Fesa confesses his sins to the bishop, the latter, refusing him absolution, tells him to go to Abba Yaceqob (Santiago).
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ እምሰብአ፡ ፌጻ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጳሪቆስ፡ ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ አባ፡ ፊላታዎስ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ዘሰፈየት፡ ሎቱ፡ ሠቀ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወተአምነ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ ኀጣውኢሁ

column3: The Frenchman whose wife was unable to have children.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
The reopening of the church in Harat Zuwayla.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The composition of the Wǝddāse Maryam by the Syrian potter.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
The church of Saint Mary in Spain to which she used to bring Christian captives.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዐባይ፡ ጥቀ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ አስፓንያ፡ ዘሕንጽት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘትትሌዐል፡ እምኵሎን፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያናት፡ ወዘልፈ፡ ታስተርኢ፡ ውስቴታ፡ ዐቢየ፡ ተአምረ፡ ሶበ፡ ጼወውዎሙ፡ ተንበላት፡ ለክርስቲያን፡ ዘይእቲ፡ ሀገር

column3: The Christians gathered for a feast of Saint Mary are saved from the Arabs.
The priest, Rizqallah, recovers things stolen from pilgrims.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: Bishop Michael sends Deacon John to help the monks of Däbrä Metmaq celebrate Passion Week.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: The cistern at Däbrä Metmaq is filled miraculously.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan urges Herod to pursue the Holy Family.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
Bishop Mercurius, whom the patriarch wanted to remove because of leprosy.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: The judgment of the court of Zärˀa Yaˁəqob against the Stephanites.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Synaxary entry for 16 Nahase: The Apostles visit Saint Mary in heaven.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: An Arab who has contempt for Saint Mary’s icon at Däbrä Qaləmon is punished.
Dabra Qaləmon miracles: The monk of Dabra Qaləmon who did not fast.
Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gera Anest of Baderman.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The composition of the Maṣḥafa ḥawi by Patriarch Gabriel Ibn Tarīk.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
The two blessed monks, Sadaqā and ʾƎstifānos, from the monastery of Saint Victor.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The monk who saved the church of Saint Mary in Atrib by his prayers when its destruction had been ordered by the Caliph.
Abba Mardari, who overheard twelve angels talking about going to Constantinople to hear Saint John Chrysostom praise Saint Mary.
The wealthy man to whom Saint Mary appeared in the form of a bird to save the countryside from pestilence.
Nəkʷal, the deacon from Margawkim, who spent his master’s money on the poor.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
The devout Muslim who became a Christian when Saint Mary appeared to him.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: Yeshaq, prior of Däbrä Metmaq, who fled to Scete, Egypt, to escape the burden of his office.
The priest from Cyprus who brought a particle of the Eucharist to a Jew.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ነዳይ፡ ቀሲስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቆጵሮስ፡ ወአልቦቱ፡ ምንተኒ፡ እምሲሳየ፡ ዕለት። ወሶበ፡ ጸንዐ፡ ላዕሌሁ፡ ንዲት፡ ወረኅብ፡ ሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ አሐዱ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ወተለቅሐ፡ እምኔሁ፡ ሠለስተ፡ ምእተ፡ ዲናረ

column3: Thieves try to steal from a church of Saint Mary in Syria but are unable to bring what they have stolen out of the church.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በሀገረ፡ ሻም፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወባቲ፡ ንዋይ፡ ብዙኃ። ወበአሐቲ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ተማከሩ፡ ፈያት፡ ከመ፡ ይሥርቁ፡ ንዋየ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

column3: A child whom his mother had vowed to Saint Mary is rescued from drowning.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በሀገረ፡ ወርወራ፡ እምአድያመ፡ ግብጽ፡ በጽንፈ፡ ባሕር፡ ወባቲ፡ ህየ፡ መዕዳወ፡ ከመ፡ የዓድው፡ ባቲ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወእንስሳ

column3: Däbrä Metmaq miracles: Saint Mary shows those assembled at Däbrä Metmaq a vision of Mohammad in Hell.
Some Christians held captive by a Muslim are freed by an angel and are brought to Cyprus.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ እስላም፡ በምድረ፡ ምዕራብ፡ ርኁቅ፡ እምሀገረ፡ ቆጵሮስ፡ መጠነ፡ ዕስራ፡ ዕለት፡ ወሖረ፡ ከመ፡ ይጸብዖሙ፡ ለክርስቲያን፡ በከመ፡ ልማዱ

column3: Däbrä Metmaq miracles: A Muslim official demands tribute from the monks of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
column12: ዘገብረት፡ ይእዜ፡ በደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ በዘመነ፡  ስልጣነ፡ ምስር፡ ቃይታባይ። ወበአሐቲ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ወፅአ፡ መኰንን፡ ዘእምታሕቴሁ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ከመ፡ ይዑድ፡ በሀገረ፡ ፅዒድ፡ ያስተገብእ፡ ጸብሐተ፡ ለንጉሥ

column3: A thief is hanged upside down with the objects he stole from the church of Saint Mary in Sebkahad.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በሀገረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወስማ፡ ለሀገር፡ ስብከሐድ። ወበአሐቲ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ መጽኡ፡ ሠረቅት፡ ወቦኡ፡ በሌሊት፡ ወሰበሩ፡ መሰከወ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

column3: A column falls and breaks the leg of the son of an official when Muslims destroy a church of Saint Mary in Homs.
When Satan destroys the oven of a monastery, he is compelled to serve the monks for twelve years in punishment.
The Egyptian woman who lost a silver plate while bathing in a miraculous spring.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The cupbearer of the king of France.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The Jewish cowherd who was baptized by his Christian companions.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The Frenchman whose wife was unable to have children.
The story of the penitent harlot, Mary of Egypt.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: The judgment of the court of Zärˀa Yaˁəqob against the Stephanites.
Thecla cycle: Thecla is taken to Alexandria to see her brother, Abba Esi, in a boat guided by the Archangels Gabriel and Sureyal.
Thecla cycle: Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
Thecla cycle: Abba Esi and Thecla are saved from the torture ordered by the judge (continuation of the preceding).
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The brigands who killed each other at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
Saint Mary appears as a winged maiden to John, a monk of Saint Macarius.
Saint Mary appears to Yohannes Kama.
The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary and fell into the doing of a sin.
A priest is warned by an angel not to rush when incensing the icon of Saint Mary.
The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.
The lamp before the icon of Saint Mary that the priest tipped over.
The story of Pifamon, the martyr from Awsim.
The man who accepted fine clothes as a bribe for future favors.
A priest becomes insane after his entire family dies of the plague.
A stream runs uphill after his neighbor had diverted it.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The composition of the Wǝddāse Maryam by the Syrian potter.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
column12: አመ፡ ፲ወ፮፡ ለነሐሴ፡ አመ፡ ፍልሰተ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ሠምረ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ይሣሃሎሙ፡ ለእለ፡ ውስተ፡ ሲኦል፡ በትንብል፡ ለእሙ

column3: The priest, Rizqallah, recovers things stolen from pilgrims.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Synaxary entry for 16 Nahase: The Apostles visit Saint Mary in heaven.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The Christians gathered for a feast of Saint Mary are saved from the Arabs.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: Bishop Michael sends Deacon John to help the monks of Däbrä Metmaq celebrate Passion Week.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: The cistern at Däbrä Metmaq is filled miraculously.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan urges Herod to pursue the Holy Family.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
The five sorrows of Saint Mary.
The hungry man whom Saint Mary used to feed.
The man who would not eat before receiving Holy Communion.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The dog that ran off with a manuscript of the Miracles of Mary.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ጸሐፌ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ኀበ፡ አንበረ፡ ውእቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ውስተ፡ አፍአ፡ ቤት፡ ወመጽአ፡ እኩይ፡ ከልብ፡ ወነሥኦ፡ ወወሰዶ

column3: Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The man who was possessed by a spirit of epilepsy [nagargar] for 47 years.
The brigands who killed each other at the miraculous spring.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary and fell into the doing of a sin.
Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
Bishop Mercurius, whom the patriarch wanted to remove because of leprosy.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
Dabra Qaləmon miracles: The monk of Dabra Qaləmon who did not fast.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: Saint Mary heals the daughter of Arsaban while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: Saint Mary stays in the Temple.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The five sorrows of Saint Mary.
The reopening of the church in Harat Zuwayla.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
Dabra Qaləmon miracles: The monk of Dabra Qaləmon who did not fast.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family hides from thieves in a sycamore tree at Däbrä Metmaq.
Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon intercedes for an angel who had disobeyed the command of God.
Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
column12: ወኮነ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ነገር፡ እምድኅረ፡ ወለደቶ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወአዘዘ፡ ሄሮድስ፡ ከመ፡ ይቅትሉ፡ ሕፃናተ፡ ዘክልኤ፡ ዓማት። ወሰሚዓ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ አጐየየቶ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ። ወእንዘ፡ ትትጐየይ፡ ወአብጽሐቶ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ኃምስ፡ ወአኃዞ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ጽምዓ፡ ማይ፡ እስመ፡ ጊዜ፡ ቀትር፡ ውእቱ። ወቦአት፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ከመ፡ ትስእል፡ ማየ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ወሀቤ፡ ዝናማት፡ ወይእቲሰ፡ ብእሲት፡ ባዕልት፡ ጥቀ፡ እምንዋየ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ዓለም፡ ወበምግባረ፡ ኀጢአት፡ ወነዳይት፡ ይእቲ፡ በምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወድርክት፡ ይእቲ፡ ካልእታ፡ ለኤልዛቤል
column15: This mss has two stories with ID 321, on ff. 36v and 100r. Macomber gave incipits of one of the two stories, but he didn't specify a folio number. So currently both instances have identical incipits in the spreadsheet and the ITool. According to catalog, it seems the stories are not different (but neither is said to be a recopying). The manuscript is online.

column3: The composition of the Wǝddāse Maryam by the Syrian potter.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
The faded icon of Saint Mary that the mother-in-law wanted to discard.
The son of a rich official of Cappadocia is raised from the dead.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The lamp before the icon of Saint Mary that the priest tipped over.
The monk who saved the church of Saint Mary in Atrib by his prayers when its destruction had been ordered by the Caliph.
The Christians gathered for a feast of Saint Mary are saved from the Arabs.
The priest, Rizqallah, recovers things stolen from pilgrims.
Saint Mary appears during Mass in the church at Meneta Sard.
The story of the martyr, Saint Victor, and his mother, Martha.
The Arab woman who entrusted her jewels to a Christian for safekeeping.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
Thecla cycle: Thecla is taken to Alexandria to see her brother, Abba Esi, in a boat guided by the Archangels Gabriel and Sureyal.
The son of the Muslim ruler of Egypt blasphemes the icon of Saint Mary.
Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
When Sefengeya, wife of King Masfeyanos of Romeya, prays to have a child before the icon of Saint Mary, the icon inclines its head; Sefengeya then conceives Yeshaq (Abba Garima).
During the famine of 1120 MM [likely 1404 CE], the Arabs try to plunder the monasteries of Egypt.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The daughter of the rich man from Caesarea who could not deliver her baby.
Holy Family journey cycle: The people of an Egyptian town set fierce dogs on the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: The inhabitants of an Egyptian town who plot to hand Jesus over to King Herod are turned into animals.
Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
column12: ወኮነ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ነገር፡ እምድኅረ፡ ወለደቶ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወአዘዘ፡ ሄሮድስ፡ ከመ፡ ይቅትሉ፡ ሕፃናተ፡ ዘክልኤ፡ ዓማት። ወሰሚዓ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ አጐየየቶ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ። ወእንዘ፡ ትትጐየይ፡ ወአብጽሐቶ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ኃምስ፡ ወአኃዞ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ጽምዓ፡ ማይ፡ እስመ፡ ጊዜ፡ ቀትር፡ ውእቱ። ወቦአት፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ከመ፡ ትስእል፡ ማየ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ወሀቤ፡ ዝናማት፡ ወይእቲሰ፡ ብእሲት፡ ባዕልት፡ ጥቀ፡ እምንዋየ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ዓለም፡ ወበምግባረ፡ ኀጢአት፡ ወነዳይት፡ ይእቲ፡ በምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወድርክት፡ ይእቲ፡ ካልእታ፡ ለኤልዛቤል
