column3: The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The robber whom a bishop was commanded to bury after he was executed.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The Jewish cowherd who was baptized by his Christian companions.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
A knight tries to seduce the wife of a friend, but she is saved by a vision.
The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The woman whose baby daughter was carried off by a hyena.
An official who used to rob the poor is converted when a monk reveals that Satan was acting as his counsellor.
Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
The woman who was falsely accused of killing the child she was nursing and was condemned to death.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.

A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.

The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.

Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.

The monk whose only good work was observing the fast of Saint Mary.

column3: Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
The son of the Muslim ruler of Egypt blasphemes the icon of Saint Mary.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The church built on the tomb of Saint Mary that will turn into a ship.
The story of Saint Alexius [Abdo l a-Masih], son of Emperor Theodosius.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.

Praise of Saint Mary's greatness.

column3: A paralytic is cured at the church of Makana Iyyasus; he establishes a monastery at the tomb of Abba Anbass and lives there.

column3: Saint Mary informs Malka Sedeq in a vision that he will receive favor from Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob.

column3: Saint Mary rescues a wonder-working monk from another monastery who was living with the monks of Däbrä Maryam, when Satan comes to him in disguise and tries to throttle him.

column3: A man prays for his sick son before the icon of Saint Mary; she sends Saint Qirqos, then comes herself with Saint George to cure him.

column3: The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation.

column12: ንነግረክሙ፡ አበዊነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ወአኀዊነ፡ ፍቁራን፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይባርክሙ፡ ወያበርህ፡ አዕይንተ፡ አልባቢክሙ፡ ለሰሚዐ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘያስተፌሥሕ፡ አልባበ፡ ወይመርህ፡ ውስተ፡ መንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት። ሚመጠነ፡ ተአምረ፡ ገብረት፡ በእደዊሆሙ፡ ለአበው፡ ቀደምት፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ኍልቈ። መቅድመ፡ ኵሉ፡ ንነግረክሙ፡ ሕይወታ፡ ወንጽሕናሃ፡ እስመ፡ ኀረያ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ እምቀዳሚ። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ እምዘመደ፡ ካህናት፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ኢያቄም፡ ወአውሰበ፡ ብእሲተ፡ እምአዋልደ፡ ይሁዳ፡ ወትሰመይ፡ ሐና

column3: The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to an official who kidnapped a girl that had made a vow of virginity.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
Scete miracles: An abbot in Scete sees first a multitude of demons, then a multitude of saints.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
The woman whose baby daughter was carried off by a hyena.
Saint Mary visits Calvary.
column12: ወሖረት፡ መካነ፡ ቀራንዮ፡ ከመ፡ ትርአይ፡ ሕማማተ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ርእየት፡ አክሊለ፡ ሦክ፡ ዘአስተቀዘልዎ፡ ወደመ፡ ርእሱ፡ ዘቈስለ፡ በአክሊለ፡ ሦክ

column3: Homily on the greatness of Saint Mary.
column12: ስምዑኬ፡ አበውየ፡ ወአኀውየ፡ ሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘከመ፡ ተዓቢ፡ እምመላእክት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. መላእክትኒ፡ ያከብርዋ፡ እፎኬ፡ ኢያከብርዋ፡ መላእክት፡ ለማርያም፡ ፈድፋደ፡ እምሰብእ፡ ለወላዲተ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ

column3: The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.

The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.

The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation.

column3: A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
The knight who wanted to seduce the daughter of the cobbler.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.

The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.

The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.

The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.

column3: The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.

column3: The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: The annual apparition of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq
Mary, Annuciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter who discovered the Holy Family in flight is turned into a dog when he violates his oath not to reveal them.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family visits the king of the Semites.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family uses stones instead of a boat to cross the Nile.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The nativity of Christ
The milk of Saint Mary that was poured on the ground in Egypt.
Tiras, who did not observe holy days, becomes deaf and dumb, but he is healed when his master prays to Saint Mary.
King Dawit (1382-1413) miracles: Saint Mary makes a covenant with King Dawit of Ethiopia.
King Dawit  (1382-1413) miracles: The general of King (Dawit) of Ethiopia who defected to the enemy.
The icon of Saint Mary in the church of the "Romans" that rebuked the Ethiopians for approaching with their shoes on.
The Ethiopian pilgrim who was expelled from the Church (of the Resurrection) in Jerusalem during the Easter services.
The rich man who left the church because the priest was saying the Anaphora of Saint Mary, Gwasca, on a big feast day.
The blind teacher whom his pupils wanted to push over a cliff while they were on their way to a feast being given in honor of the Assumption.
The rich persons who stored their wealth in a church.
The man who lost a slave that he was about to sell in Barara.
King Dawit miracles: The monasteries summon King (Dawit) of Ethiopia to abdicate.
The carpenter who asked for a copy of the Gadla samaˁtat as a reward for his services in building a church.
Saint Mary appears to a priest of Däbrä Maryam in Sire.
The pilgrim who was journeying to Jerusalem through Hamda.
The icon of Saint Mary in a church of Alexandria that some Europeans tried to steal.
The punishment of a custodian of a church who did not obey the bishop.
The pious monk who drowned while crossing a river on his way to a feast that was being given by a rich man in honor of the Assumption.
Saint Mary appears to Theocleia and prepares her for martyrdom.
Giyorgis's writing: The abbot who rejected the horologium and other works of Abba Giyorgis.
Giyorgis's writing: Saint Mary cuts short her visit to a pious monk when she hears her name invoked according to the horologium of Abba Giyorgis.
The story of Michael, the scribe who converted to Islam when he was beaten.
When a couple tries to marry their son whom they had dedicated to Saint Mary, he falls sick to the point of death.
A child whom his mother had vowed to Saint Mary is rescued from drowning.
The composition of the Wǝddāse Maryam by the Syrian potter.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
Dabra Qaləmon miracles: The monk of Dabra Qaləmon who did not fast.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.

column3: The five sorrows of Saint Mary.

column3: Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.

column3: Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gera Anest of Baderman.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
Bishop Mercurius, whom the patriarch wanted to remove because of leprosy.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ ፩፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ መርቆሬዎስ፡ ዘኮነ፡ ለምጸ፡ ኵሎ፡ ሥጋሁ፡ ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዘካርያስ

column3: The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
The faded icon of Saint Mary that the mother-in-law wanted to discard.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The son of a rich official of Cappadocia is raised from the dead.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.

column3: The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
The lamp before the icon of Saint Mary that the priest tipped over.
The two blessed monks, Sadaqā and ʾƎstifānos, from the monastery of Saint Victor.
The monk who saved the church of Saint Mary in Atrib by his prayers when its destruction had been ordered by the Caliph.
The Christians gathered for a feast of Saint Mary are saved from the Arabs.
The priest, Rizqallah, recovers things stolen from pilgrims.
Saint Mary appears during Mass in the church at Meneta Sard.
The story of the martyr, Saint Victor, and his mother, Martha.
The son of the Muslim ruler of Egypt blasphemes the icon of Saint Mary.
Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
When Sefengeya, wife of King Masfeyanos of Romeya, prays to have a child before the icon of Saint Mary, the icon inclines its head; Sefengeya then conceives Yeshaq (Abba Garima).
Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon intercedes for an angel who had disobeyed the command of God.
During the famine of 1120 MM [likely 1404 CE], the Arabs try to plunder the monasteries of Egypt.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.

Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.

The daughter of the rich man from Caesarea who could not deliver her baby.

column3: Saint Mary gives a thirsty dog water to drink from her shoe.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The hungry man whom Saint Mary used to feed.
The cupbearer of the king of France.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.

column3: The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
Saint Mary appears as a winged maiden to John, a monk of Saint Macarius.
Saint Mary appears to a monk and saves him from being deceived by Satan.
The pious priest to whom Satan came for confession.
Vision of Gregory the Seer [ra'eya hebu'at].
The monastic community that was supplied with provisions by Saint Mary.
Saint Paul is taken to the third heaven and there sees Saint Mary.
Vision of Gregory the Seer [ra'eya hebu'at].
Saint Mary appears to Sawla, the wife of the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis.
The history ot Däbrä Mahew near Jerusalem and its miraculous spring.
The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Saint Mary cures the son of a Roman official in Bethlehem.
Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: Saint Mary appears to Anthony of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam (continued).
Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: The annual apparition of Saint Mary at Däbrä MetmaqThe blessing given to the animals at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam by the anointing of Saint Mary.
The Holy Spirit recounts the salvific events that have occurred on Sunday.
Vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The life of Saint Mary to the birth of Christ.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary, together with Saints Irene and Sophia, appears to Saint Basil and tells him where her icon is buried.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil finds the buried icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary tells Saint Basil to take two pillars from a pagan temple.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary sets up the pillars in the church and makes a miraculous spring flow out at their base.
Emperor Arcadius and the golden statue of Saint Mary; he asks Saint John Chrysostom to expound on Matthew 1: 25.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees Christ kissing Saint Mary's burial cloth.
Saint Peter gives Saint John Chrysostom the keys of the kingdom and Saint John the Evangelist gives him the Gospels; then Saint Mary appears to him.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews try to burn down the house where Saint Mary is staying but are burned up instead.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary's soul descends from heaven in a tent of light.
A child whom his mother had vowed to Saint Mary is rescued from drowning.
A column falls and breaks the leg of the son of an official when Muslims destroy a church of Saint Mary in Homs.
When Satan destroys the oven of a monastery, he is compelled to serve the monks for twelve years in punishment.
The Egyptian woman who lost a silver plate while bathing in a miraculous spring.
A thief is hanged upside down with the objects he stole from the church of Saint Mary in Sebkahad.
Thieves try to steal from a church of Saint Mary in Syria but are unable to bring what they have stolen out of the church.
Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: The vinedresser of Manfalut who gave his earnings to the builders of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
The woman from Cairo who lived by the river and whose daughter became blind.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob institutes monthly feasts of Saint Mary.
column12: ወካዕበ፡ ስምዑ፡ ዘከመ፡ ገብረ፡ ላቲ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ንጉሥነ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ወበጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘተሰምየ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ አስከሬነ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ማህቶተ፡ ጥበብ፡ ወምሉዓ፡ አእምሮ

column3: Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: The infidel who stole the lumber from the church at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
King Yasay of Egypt, who became a monk in Däbrä Rom.
Patriarch Tewoqritos of Jerusalem rebukes King Akratis of Egypt for not fasting or praying.
Deganna, the church builder, who was asked by King Aktab to build a temple for his pagan gods.
The story of Astaqaˀos, the European potter who was buried alive.
Barnabas from Sandafa, who used to venerate Saint Mary's icon.
Emperor Honorius, who lived like a monk.
Paraleya from Iyyoram, who was beaten by her husband because she was childless.
Qawestos, the husband of Akroseya, becomes a disciple of Saint Clement.
The soul of Christina, the wife of Aaron, an Egyptian official, goes to Heaven.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.
Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gera Anest of Baderman.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary and fell into the doing of a sin.
Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
Bishop Mercurius, whom the patriarch wanted to remove because of leprosy.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
Dabra Qaləmon miracles: The monk of Dabra Qaləmon who did not fast.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
Saint Mary gives a thirsty dog water to drink from her shoe.
The five sorrows of Saint Mary.
When Agabos from Dalga enters the church, the icon of Saint Mary weeps.
Tekta, who is childless, has a dream about ten generations ending with the moon and the sun.

column3: Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: Saint Mary stays in the Temple.
Mary, Engagement of cycle: Saint Mary is espoused to Saint Joseph.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: How the Virgin Mary gave birth (see no. 299)
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (opening)
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family visits the king of the Semites.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family uses stones instead of a boat to cross the Nile.
Holy Family journey cycle: The people of an Egyptian town set fierce dogs on the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: The inhabitants of an Egyptian town who plot to hand Jesus over to King Herod are turned into animals.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Assumption as narrated by Saint John to Prochorus.
column12: ዜና፡ ፍልሰታ። ወይእዜኒ፡ አብሮኮሮስ፡ አነ፡ አንከርኩ፡ እምዕበየ፡ ስብሐት፡ ዘተውህበ፡ ለእምነ፡ ወለእግዝእትነ፡…. ብፅዕት፡ ከርሥ፡ ዘወለደታ፡ ውስተ፡ ዓለም

column3: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Plato is present at the Transitus of Saint Mary.

column3: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Thomas relates how he was taken to Heaven and saw the body of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Anonymous homily against the report that the Apostles abandoned the body of Saint Mary when they were attacked by the Jews during her funeral procession.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary narrates to Saint John a revelation made to her by Christ on Golgotha.

The icon of Saint Mary in the church of the "Romans" that rebuked the Ethiopians for approaching with their shoes on.

The priest who left the keys of the church locked up inside.

column3: Ark of Zion cycle: Continuation of the preceding Exhortation: The Ark of Zion crossing of the Jordan and the conquest of Palestine.

The fate of the monk, Giyorgis, who followed the teachings of Za-Mika'el.

Ark of Zion cycle: God appears to King Solomon in a dream after the dedication of the Temple.

Ark of Zion cycle: The precious stones used in building the Temple.
Ark of Zion cycle: The vision of Zechariah concerning the Ark of Zion.

column3: Holy Family journey cycle: The places in Egypt visited by the Holy Family.
The story of the sorcerers Taludar, who was possessed by a demon.
Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: The infidel who stole the lumber from the church at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
King Dawit miracles: The miracle concerning the golden ink during the reign of King Dawit.
The church of Saint Mary in Spain to which she used to bring Christian captives.
Amnut, the custodian of a church in Egypt, quarrels with his bishop.
The rich man who left the church because the priest was saying the Anaphora of Saint Mary, Gwasca, on a big feast day.
Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
The son of Emperor Tiberius is raised from the dead.
John the Evangelist paints an icon of the Crucifixion for Emperor Tiberius.
Scete miracles: Eulogius, the stonemason of Scete, Egypt, who used to give hospitality to strangers.
The merchant from Senfewat who struck the icon of Saint Mary.
The old woman from Sembat who gave the offering for Saint Mary to Saint George.
Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob is given a sign of Badlay's fall.
An angel drives away the custodian of a church of Saint Mary when he was about to enter after sinning with a woman.
The European who tried to steal the icon of Saint Mary from Däbrä Sedeneya.
Mary, Dormition of Cycle: The Dormition and Transitus of Saint Mary.
column12: ነገር፡ ዘበእንተ፡ ዕርገታ። ወሶበ፡ ሞተት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. አኮ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድር፡ አላ፡ መሠጣ፡ መልአክ፡ እምዓራታ፡ ዘቦቱ፡ ይጸውርዋ፡ ምስለ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ፍቁረ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ወአብጽሐ፡ ውስተ፡ ገነት

column3: A container of oil remains suspended in mid air in a church of Saint Mary when the cord by which it was suspended breaks.
The pilgrim who was journeying to Jerusalem through Hamda.
Saint Mary gives a cup of the water of life to an Ethiopian monk in Jerusalem.
Saint Mary turns water over which her anaphora was recited by Abba Samuˀel of Wali into miraculous bread.
column12: ወካዕበ፡ ለውእቱ፡ ብእሴ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. አመ፡ ፳፡ ወ፩፡ በሰኔ፡ እንተ፡ ይእቲ፡ በዓላ፡ ወሶበ፡ ፈጸመ፡ ጸሎቶ፡ እንዘ፡ የዓጥን፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. እመ፡ መለኮት፡ በአንብዕ፡ ወበገዓር፡ ብዙኅ። ወእምድኅረ፡ ፈጸመ፡ ጸሎቶ፡ አስተጋብኦ፡ ለማይ፡ ነሢኦ፡ በእደዊሁ፡ ፈቂዶ፡ ከመ፡ ይስተዮ። ወሶበ፡ ተመጠወ፡ ኮነት፡ ይእቲ፡ ማይ፡ ፀዓዳ፡ ኅብስተ፡ በውስተ፡ እዴሁ

column3: Oz, the Byzantine monk, is shown a vision of Hell by Saint Urael.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the rich man who refused to give him a tablet [saleda] for an icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary heals a servant girl from a magic spell.
column12: ወከመ፡ ኆፀ፡ ባሕር፡ ኍላቋሁ፡ ከማሁ፡ ኢይትረከብ፡ ኍልቈ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ርኁቅ፡ ውእቱ፡ እምልበ፡ መዋቲ፡ ኢይትረከብ፡ በኃሢሥ፡ ወኢይትሌለይ፡ በጥንቃቄ፡ በልሳነ፡ መዋቲ፡ ነባቢ፡ ኢይክል፡ ፍጻሜሁ። ወይእዜኒ፡ እንግርክሙ፡ በከመ፡ ሰማዕኩ፡ ቀዲሙ፡ በዕዝንየ፡ ወከማሁ፡ ርኢኩ፡ በአዕይንትየ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ተአምር፡ ወእዜኑ፡ ንስቲተ፡ እምተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እንዘ፡ ያሌብወኒ፡ መንፈሰ፡ ወልዳ፡ ገባሬ፡ ዓለም፡ በጥበቢሁ፡ ሰጊድ፡ ይደሉ፡ ለስመ፡ ዚአሁ፡ ይእዜኒ፡ ወዘልፈኒ፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ዓመት፡ በቤተ፡ አጋዕዝታ፡ ወሶበ፡ ሖሩ፡ አጋዕዝቲሃ፡ ኀዲጎሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤቶሙ፡ ወሠወረ፡ ሶቤሃ፡ ፀሐይ፡ ብርሃኖ

column3: Daniel from Constantinople, who wanted to go to church to receive Communion even when there was fighting in the streets.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቍስጥንጥንየ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዳንኤል፡ ዘይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ዘኵሎ፡ ይእኅዝ፡ በጸንዓ፡ ኃይሉ፡ ዘያርዕድ፡ ለሰማይ፡ ወያድለቅልቃ፡ ለምድር፡ በምጽአቱ

column3: The story of Julius Aqfahasi.
The story of King Tarses of Fars, who loved to kill Christians.
The Jew from Rome who wanted to kill Christians, but was seized by the priests of the church of Saint Mary.
Archbishop Tilas, who was seized by Jews while carrying a golden chalice.
Elias from Elkesus, who was falsely accused and was suspended by the abbot.
A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
King Yasay of Egypt, who became a monk in Däbrä Rom.
Saint Mary heals the wounds of Ermeyis of Sidon with a drop of her milk.
Deganna, the church builder, who was asked by King Aktab to build a temple for his pagan gods.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሳም፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዴገና፡ ሐናፄ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘይጸርብ፡ ዕፀወ፡ ወይወቅር፡ ዕብነ

column3: Patriarch Tewoqritos of Jerusalem rebukes King Akratis of Egypt for not fasting or praying.
Sara from Mesot, who became insane and went about naked.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በሀገረ፡ ምሶት፡ ዘስማ፡ ሳራ፡ ዘታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወባቲ፡ ደዌ፡ ዕፁበ፡ ወአኃዛ፡ ለዘኳንና፡ ነገርጓር

column3: The story of Astaqaˀos, the European potter who was buried alive.
King Bartaqu of Greece, who became a monk.
Barnabas from Sandafa, who used to venerate Saint Mary's icon.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሰንደፋ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በርናባስ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ጸሎት፡ ወጾም፡ ወገያሴ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘኮነ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይተግህ፡ መዓልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፡ እንበለ፡ አጽርዖ፡ አንብቦ፡ ውዳሴሃ

column3: Thecla cycle: Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
Vision of Gregory the Seer [ra'eya hebu'at].
The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Paraleya from Iyyoram, who was beaten by her husband because she was childless.
Qawestos, the husband of Akroseya, becomes a disciple of Saint Clement.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ በሀገረ፡ ቃህራ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይትቀነይ፡ ላቲ፡ ወይገብር፡ በዓለ፡ ፍልሰተ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ሰናይት፡ ወፈራሂተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወትከብር፡ በዓላ፡ ወሰንበታተ፡ ቦሙ፡ ፪፡ ውሉድ፡ እምድኅረ፡ ኮኑ፡ መካን፡ ዘወሀበቶሙ፡ እግዝእትነ

column3: The story of Saint Menas and his brother.
The temptations that Akroseya, the wife of Qawestos, overcame.
When Pariqos of Fesa confesses his sins to the bishop, the latter, refusing him absolution, tells him to go to Abba Yaceqob (Santiago).
The conversion of a Muslim merchant who had been imprisoned in Naples.
The magistrate whom the king accused of embezzlement.
The hunter who caught a gassa kalb in his net.
Saint Mary appears to a priest of Däbrä Maryam in Sire.
Saint Alexius lives for fifteen years near a church of Saint Mary in Armenia.
Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter who discovered the Holy Family in flight is turned into a dog when he violates his oath not to reveal them.
The thieves who stole the furnishings of a church of Saint Mary and refused to restore them when she appeared to them.
The Ethiopian general who went off to fight the Muslims without the consent of the king.
The new tabot of Saint Mary that was found outside the box in which it had been placed.
The punishment of an Ethiopian woman who swore falsely that she had not committed adultery with another woman's husband.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and Batergela Maryam, who is accused of treason and is imprisoned but delivered from the plague.
Vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family arrives at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: The Muslims who spent the night at the ruins of Däbrä Metmaq.
Däbrä Metmaq miracles: The untrustworthy camel driver of Däbrä Metmaq.
The rich persons who stored their wealth in a church.
A Christian community is attacked by a neighboring Muslim community.
A Jew is led to baptism by a dream about a lion and a monk; afterwards he curses a Jew at the latter's request.
A monk, while guarding a church, has a nocturnal emission and finds himself suddenly outside the courtyard of the church.
The blind teacher whom his pupils wanted to push over a cliff while they were on their way to a feast being given in honor of the Assumption.
When a couple tries to marry their son whom they had dedicated to Saint Mary, he falls sick to the point of death.
King Dawit miracles: The monasteries summon King (Dawit) of Ethiopia to abdicate.
The pious monk who drowned while crossing a river on his way to a feast that was being given by a rich man in honor of the Assumption.
Thieves try to steal from a church of Saint Mary in Syria but are unable to bring what they have stolen out of the church.
The brother of Emperor Constantine who wanted to marry the empress while Constantine was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ቍስጠንጢኖስ፡ ወስመ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ብራቲላ፡ ወታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወተካየደ፡ ውእቱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ምስለ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ከመ፡ ይሑር፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ኀበ፡ ተሰቅለ

column3: Homily on the miracles of Saint Mary.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (opening)
column12: በእንተ፡ ስብከተ፡ ጌና፡ ወበእንተ፡ ማርያም፡ ወኤልሳቤጥ፡ ወበእንተ፡ ወልደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዝውእቱ፡ ቃል፡ ዘኢይትነገር። ሀበኒ፡ ቃለ፡ ዘይዜምር፡ ስብሐቲከ፡ ባዕል፡ ኅቡዕ፡ ዘሠምረ፡ ይትከሠት

column3: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): The Miraculous Conception of Saint John the Baptist.
column12: ወናሁ፡ ኤልሳቤጥኒ፡ ፀንሰት፡ እንዘ፡ መካን፡ ይእቲ፡ እስመ፡ መንክር፡ ይእቲ፡ በመንክር፡ ተወክፈቶ

column3: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): The Visitation of Saint Mary to St. Elizabeth.
column12: ወሖረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ትርአየ፡ ለዓረጊት፡ ወእንተ፡ በልየት፡ ፀንሰት፡ እስመ፡ አምነት፡ ቃለ፡ ዘሰምዓት

column3: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Gabriel the Archangel.
column12: ወፈነወ፡ በአፈ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ ኀበ፡ ወለተ፡ ዳዊት፡ ወተምህረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስጢረ፡ ኅቡዓ፡ ባሕቲታ፡ ወከሠተት፡ ለሰብእ፡ ዘታነገራ፡ መልአክ

column3: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Holy Spirit.
column12: ወኤልሳቤጥኒ፡ እንዘ፡ ዓዲ፡ እስመ፡ ምልዕተ፡ መንፈስ፡ ይእቲ፡ አዕመረት፡ አንፈርዕፆቶ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ወቀፀበቶ፡ ለአቡሁ

column3: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Home of Saint Mary
column12: ወተመይጠት፡ ትግባዕ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወእምድኅረ፡ ዝንቱ፡ እስመ፡ በጽሐ፡ ጊዜሃ፡ ትለድ፡ ወሌዋዊ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ተወክፈ፡ ወአዕመረ፡ ከመ፡ ፀንሰት፡ እግዝእትነ

column3: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Mysteries.
column12: ምስጢር፡ ኅቡዕ፡ ዘተነግረ፡ እምኀበ፡ አብ፡ አምላክከ፡ ይዕቀብዎ፡ ከመ፡ ኢትክሥቱ፡ ለዘአፍአ

column3: Emperor Honorius, who lived like a monk.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Theodore the Anatolian.
A column falls and breaks the leg of the son of an official when Muslims destroy a church of Saint Mary in Homs.
The prodigal son of a man who used, when he was alive, to feed two persons; Saint Mary promises him riches, but he finds only two grains of gold.
The monk who was expelled from school when he could not pay his teacher.
The mourning of Saint John the Baptist for his mother.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ መጥምቅ፡ እንዘ፡ ገዳመ፡ አጐየየቶ፡ እሙ፡ ኤልሳቤጥ፡ ውስተ፡ ገዳም፡ አመ፡ ቀተሎሙ፡ ሄሮድስ፡ ለሕፃናት

column3: Saint Mary appears to the gabaz of her church in Waybela and tells him about the fall of Badlay.
Mary, Assummption of: In a vision Saint Mary is shown the Paradise of the Just.
column12: ወትቤ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወአውሥአኒ፡ ወይቤለኒ፡ ወልድየ፡ ንዒ፡ ኀቤየ፡ ኦእምየ፡ ናንሶሱ፡ ኀበ፡ ገነተ፡ ጻድቃን

column3: The chastisement of the heretic, Nestorius.
A Roman official is prevented from approaching the Holy Sepulcher.
Saint Mary's promises to those who are devoted to her.
column12: ስምዑ፡ እንግርክሙ፡ ውሉደ፡ ጥምቀት፡ ዘትቤ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ዕድ፡ ወአንስት፡ አዕሩግ፡ ወሕፃናት፡ ቀሳውስት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ እለ፡ ትቀውሙ፡ ዝየ፡ ለሰሚዓ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ክቡር፡ ወልዑል፡ ወሥሙር፡ ወታስምዐነ፡ ቃለ፡ ፍሥሐ፡ ወሐሴት፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን። ወትቤ፡ ለኒ፡ በዝዓለም፡ አዓቅበክሙ፡ እምዕለት፡ እኪት፡ ወእምሰዓታተ፡ መንሱት

column3: The Egyptian woman who lost a silver plate while bathing in a miraculous spring.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gera Anest of Baderman.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary and fell into the doing of a sin.
Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
Bishop Mercurius, whom the patriarch wanted to remove because of leprosy.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].

The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The daughter of the rich man from Caesarea who could not deliver her baby.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The faded icon of Saint Mary that the mother-in-law wanted to discard.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Saint Mary appears as a winged maiden to John, a monk of Saint Macarius.

Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
An Egyptian woman comes to Saint Mary in Bethlehem and is healed of her fever.
Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].

column3: The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.

Ark of Zion cycle: When Israel Sins against the Law, the Philistines defeat them and carry off the Ark of Zion, which then chastizes them.
Ark of Zion cycle: The news of the capture of the Ark of Zion is brought to Eli.
Ark of Zion cycle: When Israel Sins against the Law, the Philistines defeat them and carry off the Ark of Zion, which then chastizes them.
Ark of Zion cycle: The havoc wrought among the Philistines by the Ark of Zion.
Ark of Zion cycle: The havoc wrought among the Philistines by the Ark of Zion.

Paraleya from Iyyoram, who was beaten by her husband because she was childless.

Saint Mary's promises to those who are devoted to her.

The acts of Saint Paul in Wariqon, as narrated by Saint Peter.

Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): The Miraculous Conception of Saint John the Baptist.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): The Visitation of Saint Mary to St. Elizabeth.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Gabriel the Archangel.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Holy Spirit.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Home of Saint Mary
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Mysteries.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Saint Elizabeth.
column12: ወበይእቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ብዙኃ፡ ፍቅር፡ ወኃይል፡ ወምሕረት፡ ወብዕል፡ ጸጋሁ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ዘመንገለ፡ ሰብእ

column3: Mary, Annuciation of cycle: Homily on the Annunciation, preceded by the gospel text.
column12: ወበሳድስ፡ ወርኅ፡ ተፈነወ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ እምኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሀገረ፡ ገሊላ፡…. እንዘ፡ ኢየአምር፡ ብእሴ። ኦቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ እንተ፡ አውሥአቶ፡ ለመልአክ፡ በግህደት፡ ንጽሕት፡ ድንግልናሃ

column3: Mary, Annuciation of cycle: Homily on the Annunciation (continuation).
column12: ኀደረ፡ እግዚእ፡ ውስተ፡ ከርሠ፡ ድንግል፡ ፱፡ አውራኃ፡ ወ፭፡ ዕለተ፡ ከመ፡ ሰብእ፡ ልህቀ፡ ውስተ፡ ማኅፀን

column3: The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The knight who wanted to seduce the daughter of the cobbler.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The Jewish cowherd who was baptized by his Christian companions.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
A knight tries to seduce the wife of a friend, but she is saved by a vision.
The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
The man who was possessed by a spirit of epilepsy [nagargar] for 47 years.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The brigands who killed each other at the miraculous spring.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (opening)
column12: በእንተ፡ ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለቴዎፍሎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ወዘከመ፡ ተናገረቶ፡ ወአጽነዐቶ፡ እምደካመ፡ ፍኖት። ይቤ፡ ቴዎፍሎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ስምዑ፡ አበውየ፡ ወአኀውየ፡ ዘእነግረክሙ፡ በፍርሃት፡ ወበረዓድ፡ ወበሃይማኖት፡ ርትዕት

column3: Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan urges Herod to pursue the Holy Family.
column12: በእንተ፡ ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለቴዎፍሎስ፡…. እምድካመ፡ ፍኖት፡…. ወእንዘ፡ ከመዝ፡ አስተርአዮ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ለሄሮድስ፡ ቃለ፡ በቃል

column3: Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
column12: በእንተ፡ ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለቴዎፍሎስ፡…. እምድካመ፡ ፍኖት፡…. ወእንዘ፡ ይነውም፡ ዮሴፍ፡ በሌሊት፡ አስተርአዮ፡ መልአከ፡ እግዚአብሔር

column3: Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The Frenchman whose wife was unable to have children.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ አፍርንጊ፡ እምአድያመ፡ አፍራንሳ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እምንእሱ፡ ወይትለአካ፡ በኵሉ፡ ኀይሉ። ወሶበ፡ በጽሐ፡ አምጣነ፡ አውስቦ፡ አስተዋሰብዎ፡ አበዊሁ፡ ወለተ፡ እምአውላደ፡ አፍርንጊ

column3: During the famine of 1120 MM [likely 1404 CE], the Arabs try to plunder the monasteries of Egypt.
column12: ወኮነ፡ በ፲፻፡ ወ፻፡ ወ፳፡ ዓመተ፡ ሰማዕታት፡ ንጹሓን፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአብ፡ እግዚእ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አባ፡ ማቴዎስ፡ ወኮነ፡ በሀገረ፡ ምስር፡ ረሓብ፡ ዐቢይ

column3: Dabra Qaləmon miracles: The monk of Dabra Qaləmon who did not fast.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ በደብረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዐቢይ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘቀልሞን፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ሠናይት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወኮነ፡ ውስተ፡ ዛቲ፡ ቅድስት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ሥዕል፡ ዐቢይ፡ ወመንክር

column3: Dabra Qaləmon miracles: The monk of Dabra Qaləmon who did not fast.
column12: ወኮነ፡ በአሐዱ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ሖሩ፡ ሰብእ፡ መነኮሳት፡ እምደብረ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘቀልሞን፡ ለፈጽሞ፡ መፍቅደ፡ ደብር

column3: Dabra  Qaləmon miracles: An Arab steals the scissors of the tailor of Dabra Qaləmon.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ በዝንቱ፡ ደብረ፡ ቀልሞን፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ሐፂር፡ ዘአድኀነቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. እምማእሰረ፡ ዐረብ

column3: Qommos Raphael from Däbrä ʾƎnṣǝnā and the sacrament of confession.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ስዒድ፡ በደብረ፡ እንጽና፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወእስከ፡ ይእዜ፡ ሀሎ፡ ወኵሉ፡ አሐዱ፡ አሐዱ፡ የአምሮ፡ ወይሰመይ፡ ምኔተ፡ አቡ፡ ንዕናእ

column3: Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: An Arab who has contempt for Saint Mary’s icon at Däbrä Qaləmon is punished.
column12: ወኮነ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ እግዚእ፡ ክቡር፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ሰማንያ፡ ወሰመንቱ፡ እምሊቃነ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘእለእስክንድርያ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሊቅ፡ በደብረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘቀልሞን፡ ዘስሙ፡ ሰሎሞን

column3: The composition of the Maṣḥafa ḥawi by Patriarch Gabriel Ibn Tarīk.
column12: ወኮነ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ አብ፡ ክቡር፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ወልደ፡ ተሪክ፡ ወበጽሖ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ በአስ፡ ወጸልእ፡ ምስለ፡ ሕዝቡ

column3: Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
column12: ወኮነ፡ በደብረ፡ ቀልሞን፡ ወሶበ፡ በዝኀ፡ ተአምሪ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘታስተርኢ፡ ውስተ፡ ሥዕል፡ ዘሀለወት፡ በደብረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘቀልሞን፡ ወፈድፋደሰ፡ ለዐረብ፡ እለ፡ ሀለዉ፡ ዐውዳ

column3: Nəkʷal, the deacon from Margawkim, who spent his master’s money on the poor.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ ብእሲ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ ዲያቆን፡ እምሰብአ፡ መርግ፡ ወኬም፡ ወስሙ፡ ንኳል

column3: The priest from Nārdin who was accused because he kept a nun in his house.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ናርዲን፡ ወተሠይመ፡ ቀሲሰ፡ በላዕለ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ድንግል፡ ዘይእቲ፡ ሀገር

column3: The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ እምአንስተ፡ ዐረብ፡ ወባቲ፡ ውሕዘተ፡ ደም፡ እምብዙኅ፡ ዓመታት

column3: Yoḥannǝs finds a copy of the acts of Saints Juliana and Barbara that he had lost.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ በቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወብፅዕት፡ ንጽሕት፡ ወልዕልት፡ እምሰማዕታት፡ በርባራ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ዮሐንስ

column3: The lamp before the icon of Saint Mary that the priest tipped over.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወዓዲ፡ ሥዕል፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በገቦ፡ ንድቅ፡ ዘየማን

column3: The two blessed monks, Sadaqā and ʾƎstifānos, from the monastery of Saint Victor.
column12: ወሀለዉ፡ ክልኤቱ፡ መነኮሳት፡ ቡሩካን፡ እምድብረ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ማር፡ ፊቅጦር፡ በማኅፈደ፡ ናርቆን

column3: The Christians gathered for a feast of Saint Mary are saved from the Arabs.
ʾƎmma Yoḥannǝs and the Ethiopian monk who was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ ብእሲት፡ መሃይምንት፡ ቅድስት፡ ወቡርክት፡ ወተኀድር፡ በአሐዱ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉራተ፡ ታሕታይ፡ ግብጽ፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ ስምባጥ

column3: The European who wanted to steal the bars of the door to the Manger at Bethlehem.

column3: The conversion of a Muslim merchant who had been imprisoned in Naples.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.

column12: ወሀለወት፡ በቅሩበ፡ ዓይነ፡ ማይ፡ ዘአንቅዐ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ መጠርያ፡  በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወይብልዋ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ደወል፡ ምኔተ፡ ሰርድ

column3: Däbrä Qaləmon miracles: Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon intercedes for an angel who had disobeyed the command of God.
column12: ዘገብረቶ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ዘእምርት፡ ገባሪታ፡ ተአምራት፡ ወመንክራት፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቀልሞን። ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ተምዐ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ላዕለ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ በእንተ፡ እከዮሙ፡ ወኀጢአቶሙ፡ ለሰብእ፡ እለ፡ ይነብሩ፡ ውስቴታ

column3: The story of the martyr, Saint Victor, and his mother, Martha.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ፈራሂተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወመፍቀሪተ፡ ነዳያን፡ ወመፍቀሪተ፡ ጽድቅ፡ ወምጽዋት፡ ወሥርጉት፡ በኵሉ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ በጾም፡ ወበጸሎት፡ ዘስማ፡ ማርታ

column3: Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gera Anest of Baderman.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ጽዒድ፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ በድርማን፡ ወይነብር፡ ውስቴታ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አብርሃም፡ ወስመ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ጌራ፡ አንስት

column3: The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
column12: ወሀለወት፡ ብእሲት፡ ነዳይት፡ ወሞተ፡ ምታ፡ ወኀደገ፡ አዋልደ፡ ለአሐቲ፡ ስማ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለካልእት፡ ስማ፡ ማርታ፡ ወለሣልሲት፡ ስማ፡ የዋሂት

column3: The Arab woman who entrusted her jewels to a Christian for safekeeping.
column12: ወኮነ፡ በሀገረ፡ ጽዒድ፡ ፀብእ፡ ምስለ፡ ዐረብ፡ በበይናቲሆሙ። ወአሐቲ፡ እምአንስተ፡ ዐረብ፡ ነሥአት፡ ሥርጓ፡ ዘወርቅ፡ ወዘብሩር፡ ወአዕቀበቶሙ፡ ኀበ፡ ብእሲት፡ ክርስቲያናዊት

column3: The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary and fell into the doing of a sin.
column12: ወሀለዉ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ፪፡ አኃው፡ ፍቁራን፡ ወጽፉቀ፡ ይትፋቀሩ፡ በበይናቲሆሙ፡ ወየአምሩ፡ ግብረ፡ እድ፡ ወግብረ፡ እዶሙሰ፡ ጽሒፍ

column3: The abbot who did not allow the Miracles of Mary to be read in his monastery.
column12: ወኮነ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወሀገሩሰ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ይእቲ፡ ወሰብአ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ነገሥታቲሃ፡ ወጳጳሳቲሃ፡ ወኵሉ፡ ሕዝባ፡ እድ፡ ወአንስት፡ ያፈቅርዋ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

column3: Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: A man killed during the construction of the church of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam is raised from the dead.
column12: ወእንዘ፡ የሐንጹ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ሶበ፡ አዘዞ፡ ንጉሥ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር

column3: The story of the sorcerers Taludar, who was possessed by a demon.
column12: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡… እንተ፡ ገብረቶ፡ በላዕለ፡ መሠርይት፡ ጣውሉዳር፡ ወጣማር፡ መርዓታ፡ ለድምሳሴሆን፡ በጽንዐ፡ መዝራዕታ። ነገረ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘነገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘእለስክንድርያ፡ ወልደ፡ ዲዮስቆሮስ፡ ወትቤ፡ ስማዕ፡ እንግርከ፡ ዘረከበነ፡ አመ፡ ናንሶሱ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ

column3: The son of the Muslim ruler of Egypt blasphemes the icon of Saint Mary.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ምስለ፡ ወልዱ፡ በሀገረ፡ ምስር፡ ወውእቱ፡ ተንባላታይ፡ ዕልው፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአባ፡ እልስክንድሮስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት

column3: Scete miracles: Eulogius, the stonemason of Scete, Egypt, who used to give hospitality to strangers.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አውሎጊስ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወብእሲ፡ ነዳይ፡ ወፀራቤ፡ እብን፡ ውእቱ

column3: Saint Mary appears to Yohannes Kama.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ካማ፡ ዘኀሠሠ፡ እምንእሱ፡ አፍቅሮቶ፡ ለክርስቶስ፡ በዐቢይ፡ ገድል፡ ወአመ፡ ልህቀ፡ ፈኀሩ፡ ሎቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ድንግለ

column3: Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: The vinedresser of Manfalut who gave his earnings to the builders of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይትጌበር፡ አዕጻዳተ፡ ወይን፡ በሀገር፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ መንፈሉጥ፡ ወኮነ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ይነሥእ፡ ዓስቦ፡ እምቈጽለ፡ ገነት

column3: Saint Mary appears as a winged maiden to John, a monk of Saint Macarius.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ቀሲስ፡ በደብረ፡ አባ፡ መቃርስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወዘልፈ፡ ታስተርእዮ፡ እግዝእትነ

column3: Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: The infidel who stole the lumber from the church at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ከሐዲ፡ ወየኀድር፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ቁስያ፡ ወባዕል፡ ጥቀ፡ በንዋይ፡ ወይጸልእ፡ ዘመደ፡ ክርስቲያን

column3: Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መስተጋድል፡ ፈድፋደ፡ በከዊነ፡ ስምዕ፡ በእንተ፡ ስመ፡ እግዝእነ፡ ወአምላክነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ሐዲስ

column3: Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ዘነግሠ፡ በሮምያ፡ እምድኅረ፡ ሞተ፡ አቡሁ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ገብረ፡ ኢየሱስ

column3: The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዲዮናስዮስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮምያ፡ ወሶበ፡ ኃጥእዎ፡ ሕዝብ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ሖሩ፡ ኀበ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት

column3: When Sefengeya, wife of King Masfeyanos of Romeya, prays to have a child before the icon of Saint Mary, the icon inclines its head; Sefengeya then conceives Yeshaq (Abba Garima).
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ መስፍያኖስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ሮምያ፡ ወስመ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ስፍንግያ፡ እስመ፡ መካን፡ ይእቲ

column3: Entawos, a pagan from Qarays, becomes a Christian after being struck by miraculous arrows.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ አሞራዊ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ቀራይስ፡ ወአረማዊ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወኢየአምር፡ ለእግዚአብሔር

column3: A man who speaks blasphemously of Saint Mary has his arms and legs cut off.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዕቡይ፡ ዘአንበረ፡ ውስተ፡ ሰማይ፡ አፉሁ፡ ወአንሶሰወ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድር፡ ልሳኑ

column3: The wife of a pagan official who wished to pray at the Holy Sepulcher is prevented until she is baptized.
column12: ኦኵልክሙ፡ ማኅበረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ክሥቱ፡ አእዛነ፡ አልባቢክሙ፡ ለሰሚዐ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወሰሚዐክሙ፡ ከመ፡ አድኃነቶሙ፡ ለኃጥኣን፡ እምስሕተቶሙ፡ በትንብልናሃ፡ በልዋ፡ ኦድንግል፡ አፍጥኒ

column3: The son of Emperor Tiberius is raised from the dead.
column12: ተአምር፡ ወውዳሴ፡ ክቡር፡ ዘገብረ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ላዕለ፡ እሙ፡ ድንግል። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጢባርዮስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ሮሜ፡ ዘበመዋዕሊሁ፡ ተሰቅለ፡ እግዚእነ

column3: John the Evangelist paints an icon of the Crucifixion for Emperor Tiberius.
column12: ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ ሖረ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ኀበ፡ ጢባርዮስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ በከመ፡ ይቤሎ፡ እግዚእነ

column3: Petros Bawares has a vision of the Trinity.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ በዋርስ፡ ወሐነጸ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ወነበረ፡ ያስተበቍዕ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ከመ፡ ትስአል፡ ሎቱ፡ ኀበ፡ ወልዳ፡ ያርኢዮ፡ ምስጢረ፡ ሥላሴሁ

column3: The conversion of the Muslim, Rewh, who is renamed Entons Haddis.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ አረማዊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ርውኅ፡ ወአመ፡ ሜጦ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ኀበ፡ አሚነ፡ ሥላሴ፡ በጸሎታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ተሰምየ፡ እንጦንስሃ፡ ሐዲሰ

column3: The wife of Mark, a priest from Mallawi, is cured of her leprosy.
column12: ተአምር፡ ዘተከሥተት፡ በእደ፡ አቡነ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አባ፡ ማቴዎስ። ወሀሎ፡ ቀሲስ፡ እምሰብአ፡ መላዊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ወቦቱ፡ ብእሲት፡ ወመጽአ፡ ላዕሌሃ፡ ለምጽ፡ ዲበ፡ ሕንብርታ

column3: Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: The monks of Saint Anthony celebrate Holy Week at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
column12: ወበዓመት፡ ፲፻ወ፩፻፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ለሰማዕታት፡ በጽሑ፡ መነኮሳት፡ እምደብረ፡ አቡነ፡ እንጦንዮስ፡ ከመ፡ ይግበሩ፡ ሰሙነ፡ ሕማማት፡ በደብረ፡ ቍስቋም

column3: A Muslim, Katib, tries to extort money from the monks of Saint Anthony.
column12: ወበዐመት፡ ፲፻፴፡ ወ፰፡ ሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ አቡነ፡ ቆሞስ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አበ፡ ምኔት፡ ዘደብረ፡ አቡነ፡ እንጦንዮስ፡ ወእሙር፡ ውእቱ፡ በቅድስና፡ ወበንጽሕ

column3: Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ በሀገር፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ እልክሱስ፡ ብእሲ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ከጢር፡ ወአረጋዊ፡ ብእሲሁ፡ ወይነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወይሴሰይ፡ እምምጽዋተ፡ ሰብእ

column3: The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
column12: ወሀለዉ፡ ፪፡ አኃው፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ ደልጋ፡ የአልሉ፡ አልባሰ፡ በቀለመ፡ ኒል፡ ወአሐዱ፡ እምኔሆሙ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ታግ

column3: Homily of John Chrysostom on the visit of Saint Mary and her Son to John the Baptist.
column12: ይቤ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ እንዘ፡ ይዜኑ፡ ዘከመ፡ ኃውጸቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ መጥምቅ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ገዳመ

column3: The story of Pifamon, the martyr from Awsim.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ፒፋሞን፡ በሀገረ፡ አውሴም፡ ክቡረ፡ ዘመድ፡ ወአቡሁ፡ መኰንነ፡ ሀገር

column3: The story of John, the martyr from Senhut.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ስንሑት፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ እምንእሱ፡ ዘአሥመሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ በሠናይ፡ ገድል

column3: The Jews plot to burn the body of Saint Mary.
column12: ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ ጥዕመት፡ ሞተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፩፡ ለጥር፡ ተማከሩ፡ አይሁድ፡ እንዝ፡ ይብሉ፡ ሚንገብር፡ ሐዘነ፡ ሞት፡ ወረደ፡ ላዕሌነ፡ በእንተ፡ ኢየሱስ

column3: A Roman official is prevented from approaching the Holy Sepulcher.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ እምመስፍንተ፡ ሮሜ፡ ወመጽአ፡ ከመ፡ ይጸሊ፡ ኀበ፡ መቃብረ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ

column3: Scete miracles: Emperor Zeno builds churches in Scete.
column12: ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ አንገሦ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ዘይኑን፡ ዲበ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ወቍስጥንጥንያ፡ ወአድያመ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወተዘከረ፡ በልቡ፡ ወይቤ

column3: A priest is warned by an angel not to rush when incensing the icon of Saint Mary.
column12: ወኮነ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ እንዘ፡ የዐውድ፡ ካህን፡ ወእንዘ፡ የዐጥን፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ ወበጽሐ፡ ኀበ፡ ሀለወ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ

column3: Scete miracles: Saint Mary blesses Scete, which Saint Macarius chooses for his monastery.
column12: ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ ኀደረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ውስተ፡ ደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ምስለ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ወሰሎሜ፡ ወባረኮ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለውእቱ፡ መካን

column3: The story of Michael, the scribe who converted to Islam when he was beaten.
column12: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘስሙ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ እምንእሱ፡ ወጸሓፊ፡ ውእቱ

column3: Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob is given a sign of Badlay's fall.
column12: ወኮነ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ በምድረ፡ አጐባ፡ ፈነወ፡ ዓላዊ፡ ሰራዊተ፡ ብዙኃነ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንዘ፡ ኢየአምር፡ ንጉሥ

column3: The story of the Muslim who lived near the churches of Saints Mark and Shenute.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
column12: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ባሕታዊ፡ በኢየሩሳሌም፡ እምመነኮሳት፡ ቀደምት፡ ወይትቀነይ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ በጾም፡ ወበጸሎት

column3: A monk, Abraham, drinks poisonous water while on a journey to visit the patriarch and dies, but is then raised from the dead.
column12: ወሀለዉ፡ ፪፡ መነኮሳት፡ ስሙ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ አብርሃም፡ ወስሙ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ይስሐቅ፡ ወፈቀዱ፡ ይሖሩ፡ ኀበ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘእለ፡ እስክንድርያ

column3: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob miracles:  Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and the invasion of Badlay.
column12: ተአምር፡ ዘገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ለዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘተሰምየ፡ ቍስጠንጢኖስ፡ ኢኮነ፡ በጸሙ፡ ወኢበጸሎቱ፡ ወኢበንጽሑ፡ ወኢበምጽዋቱ፡ ወኢበምህልላሁ፡ ኢበቀዊሞቱ፡ ወኢበአንብዑ

column3: Saint Mary appears to the gabaz of her church in Waybela and tells him about the fall of Badlay.
The story of Absadi, gardener of the monastery of St. Shenute, who used to give away vegetables from the garden.
column12: ተአምር፡ ዘከሠተት፡ እመ፡ መለኮት፡ በውስተ፡ ደብረ፡ አባ፡ ሲኖዳ፡ አበ፡ መነኮሳት፡ ዓምደ፡ ግብጽ፡ ላዕላይ። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ እምደቂቁ፡ ዘያዓቅብ፡ አትክልተ፡ በቍላት፡ ዘአኃው

column3: The wrath of Saint Mary against the prefect of a church who tried to stop the priests from making a procession while singing hymns to her.
column12: ወሀለዉ፡ ፪፡ ፍቁራን፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወአሐዱ፡ እምኔሆሙ፡ ይመልክ፡ ይእተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

column3: Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
column12: ጸጋ፡ ወኃይል፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በደወለ፡ ምስር፡ ዘምኵናነ፡ ግብጽ። ወሀለዉ፡ ዕደው፡ ዝሁራነ፡ ልብ፡ ወዕቡያነ፡ ዐይን፡ ወፈቀዱ፡ ያሥዕሉ፡ ሎሙ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ

column3: The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
column12: ስምዑ፡ አበዊነ፡ ወአኃዊነ፡ ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ በብሔረ፡ ፋርስ። ወገብአት፡ ብሔረ፡ አፍርንጊ፡ ወረከበት፡ ፩፡ ብእሴ፡ ዘእብን፡ እግሩ

column3: A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The robber whom a bishop was commanded to bury after he was executed.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Saint Mary appears to Sawla, the wife of the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis.
The history ot Däbrä Mahew near Jerusalem and its miraculous spring.
Saint Mary cures the son of a Roman official in Bethlehem.
Saint Mary heals a woman possessed by evil spirits.
An Egyptian woman comes to Saint Mary in Bethlehem and is healed of her fever.
A woman whose right eye had been blinded by a demon is healed by Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to Timothy, Patriarch of Alexandria, in the church of Saint Pachomius in Alexandria.
Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam miracles: Saint Mary appears to Anthony of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam (continued).
